title: [Report] Run on Linux with Wine
body:
I know that there are some topics are in this regard somewhere on the forum because I was able to use it the Alpha client on linux with wine because of a post on forum, but sadly I cannot find it where it was.

Image: https://goo.gl/photos/oM71hWf2upEA4bLn7

So for linux players who already has a environment for running the game should be not complicate to install the client, the trick is to run the client with the
**--no-sandbox** flag and it should work.

For linux users who does not have environment for the game I can suggest the [PlayOnLinux](http://www.playonlinux.com) which is a tool for managing wineprefixes and it has complete install scripts for many games including League of Legends. It has limitations of corse, for me the store is useless because of a session cookie which can't save in the webview because the api does not support that, it was worked about 6.0 but since then that changed. An other issue is sometime with switching desktops and using GUI features the game canvas freeze. But in most of the time it working fine.

replies.body: This looks promising, I should give it a try. Thanks for sharing!

so with the preseason update my alpha client broke. I've found that installing vcrun2015 fixes the alpha client. You still need the --no-sandbox argument. You can install vcrun2015 in your wineprefix with these commands: 

wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Winetricks/winetricks/master/src/winetricks
chmod +x winetricks
WINEPREFIX=/home/[user]/.PlayOnLinux/wineprefix/[league install folder] ./winetricks -q vcrun2015

of course you need to change the [user] to your home folder name, so in my case it was /home/krash/.PlayOnLinux
then you change the [league install folder] to your League install location that you named with playonlinux. so in my case the full string was:

WINEPREFIX=/home/krash/.PlayOnLinux/wineprefix/League ./winetricks -q vcrun2015.


make sure you keep your caps and everything

If anyone needs help with Linux gaming you can always PM me
